page.title: 07SALMON-LITTLE LOCH BROOM
page.content: 1km WEST OF SCORAIG IS THE DISUSED SALMON FISHING STATION.NOWADYS THE SCORAIG SALMON FISHING,WHICH IS RENTED FROM EILEAN DARACH,IS OPERATED FROM BADLUARACH JETTY.THE SEASON LASTS FROM 12thFEBRUARY TO 12thAUGUST,WITH FISHING ACTUALLY STARTING THE FIRST WEEK OF MAY.THE PEAK PERIOD IS AROUND MIDSUMMER,WHEN AS MANY AS 100 FISH A DAY COULD BE CAUGHT IN A GOOD YEAR.BUT CATCHES VARY CONSIDERABLY FROM YEAR TO YEAR.THE SALMON RANGE IN WEIGHT FROM 3 TO 20 POUNDS. THE TRADITIONAL COBLE,CREWED BY 2 MEN,IS USED TO LAY AND CHANGE THE NETS.ONE END OF THE NET IS SECURED TO THE SHORE AND THE OTHER END ANCHORED OUT AT SEA.THE NETS NEED TO BE CLEANED EVERY 10 DAYS.A RUBBER DINGHY,POWERED BY A POWERFUL OUTBOARD,IS USED FOR THE DAILY FISHING,AND FOR TRAVELLING FROM SCORAIG TO THE OTHER 2 GROUNDS.
